explains: vt. 使眩晕；使惶惑（daze 的过去式）
wordGroup: in a daze 在恍惚中；茫然；眼花缭乱；不知所措

sentences.en: Jimmy was still dazed by the blow to his head.
sentences.cn: 吉米由于头部被击，仍然神志不清。

sentences.en: At the end of the interview I was dazed and exhausted.
sentences.cn: 采访结束的时候，我感到头昏眼花、精疲力竭。

sentences.en: Survivors waited for the rescue boats, dazed and frightened.
sentences.cn: 生还者不知所措，心有余悸，等待着救援船只。
